website_summaries.verdict: A hidden gem that not everyone knows about. Nevertheless, it is an excellent choice.
pros: A low center of gravity means less chance of tipping over
Carries heavier kids with ease and even has a bicycle bell
cons: There have been reports of poor attention to finishing details (stickers with bubbles under them, etc

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for my 3 year old twins. We have had them for a year. THEY ARE POOR QUALITY! DO NOT BUY! The tires are lumpy and the twins get super frustrated trying to pedal on lumpy tires. The seats are not steady. We were very, very disappointed. We took them to REI to try and get the tires fixed and they were dismayed at the quality and suggested that they must be knockoffs. They said they couldn't even fix them and we ended up replacing them on their next birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these bikes for our preschool students 2 weeks ago. All 3 bikes are broke already with just 8 days on the playground. Seats are loose and come off easy, bells were broke within days and now the peddles are falling off. I am very upset with the quality of theses bikes and our fundraising money was wasted! The students waited along time for new bikes and worked hard raising money to buy these! hope the company will do something about this and not disappoint many families.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Long-term review (2017-2020): Well made, classic looks, stable for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in September 2017. As of April 2020, my 4.5 years old son has been using it now for 3.5 year now; he loves it. My younger son also now enjoys it and well. No significant accident so far. The low seat improves stability. Bucket seat seems comfortable. The rubber tires are nice. No punctures in 3.5 years. We store it indoors; however, it is exposed to wet grass. We have no issues with rust so far. Oiled it few times. No abnormal squeaks or squeals. Overall, it is well and fully operational after 3.5+ year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great quality - she loves it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old absolutely loves it!!! She rides it mostly in the house on carpet since it's so hot out now. The frame and wheels, tires, seat, handle bars etc are of good material. Not a plastic little lightweight tricycle. It's the real deal and the rest tires are spread apart with a low seat making this tricycle nice and balanced for rides and turns!!! Everyone who's seen it says it's an awesome looking tricycle and the quality goes hand in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco

customer_reviews.title: As much as we wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: We got this trike for our 2 year old for his birthday. First trike didn't have manual. we were able to assemble it wiout any problems using downloaded manual. We took it out but the peddle fell off within 15 min and kept falling off. So we replaced it. Second tricycle came in with manual all shinny and packed nicely. We put it together and took it out. But this one was making this horrible squeaking sound so loudly that it was impossible to anywhere near it. I wish I could add a video so you could see and hear it ourselves!
customer_reviews.author: casualcritic88

customer_reviews.title: Plastic bearings, rear wheel squeaking loudly.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 30 month old grandson. He used it twice and the left back wheel started squeaking loudly. Upon inspection the bearings are plastic.. seriously wth. Returning for a replacement. But, i have my doubts that a replacement will be any better. Will update at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: itsjohnib

customer_reviews.title: Not stable & not made for young children.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old son. It was not what I expected at all! After being adjusted multiple times, the handlebars mover separately from the wheel causing the bike to turn while the handlebars are facing straight. It is also difficult for my son to peddle on this bike because of how it’s made. I would much rather get a regular small bicycle with training wheels for him that he will be able to ride and I won’t have to push him on. Wish I could send it back and get my money back!!
customer_reviews.author: MNELSON

customer_reviews.title: beyond impressed!
customer_reviews.text: ignored the negative reviews.... due to the low level of what they reviewed on.. Super impressed at the quality of this tricycle! i have bought too many for the first child and was never impressed with anything i got her.... hence why i kept going.... bought this for the 2nd and both the 1st (6 years old) and 2nd 18 months old play with it! and feel super comfortable with it being in my house on our hard wood floors that (god forbid my husband would allow)!
customer_reviews.author: L. Amyotte

customer_reviews.title: Pedal slides off
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I contacted Schwinn customer service and they sent me a replacement pedal for free. It worked perfectly. I bought this tricycle as a Christmas gift for my son. It is very stable, looks really cool, and son loves it. However, only in a few months of light riding one of the pedals fell off. It seems the piece of plastic that held the pedal in place either wore out or broke, so now the pedal slides off and there is no way to fix it. I contacted support requesting a new pedal that I hope will fix the issue. Will update my review when they reply.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: If I could give negative stars, I would. Ordered it for my two year old grandson for Christmas. Pedal fell off the day he opened it, before he took it outside. Returned it and got a replacement very easily- should be good, right? Wrong! Two months to the day, the pedal fell off the second trike. Obviously a flaw in design.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lee Jones, MD

customer_reviews.title: Will not purchase anything large from Amazon again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Schwinn Roadster kids tricycle for my 4 year old grandson for Christmas. He simply loves the bike, but the one pedal keeps falling off. I purchased it on oct 8 so that I wouldn't run into a problem about availability when it got closer to Christmas. I called Amazon and they wouldn't do anything because it was past the return date. I called Schwinn and had was told they would have 2 new pedals in the mail immediately. When it comes to large items for birthdays or Christmas, I will definitely Not purchase the item from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: James Donovan

customer_reviews.title: unsafe at any speed ,dont trust schwinn
customer_reviews.text: Schwinn/dorel shipped this trike and many others with known steering defects, front forks very loose cant be adjusted, others returned trike only to receive another unsafe trike from Schwinn, all Schwinn trikes should be recalled. keep your kids safe avoid Schwinn products, was once a great American company, will try to machine a spacer if unsuccessful will return for refund, grand child very disappointed, Schwinn went bankrupt, now owned by multi national corp, DOREL INDUSTRIES . nuff said !
customer_reviews.author: masterchiefdavis

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good product but had to order 2 times, one came broken and the other 2 days after assembled had a flat tire with no use that was not even able to repair. So as I had both at home, I didn’t have returned yet, so I canibalize parts from both and built a new one. The final result was not perfect because the tire is not line up and make noise when using. Very sad for a product that I had great expectation...I wish I could return and buy from other vendor...I can’t believe that Schwin has this quality...this should be refurbished or even defective....so disappointing.....
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy trike for the preschool aged kiddos
customer_reviews.text: My 3 almost 4 year old who is not interested in a two wheeled bike yet loves it. The bell is her favorite part I think. The tricycle is sturdy and well made. She's a taller kid for her age and my biggest concern was her legs being too long for the trike (she's 39" tall). It's the perfect size with the seat adjusted to the middle setting. She (we) have received many compliments on the appearance as well. The only word of advice I would give is keep it indoors and dry it off if it gets wet to prevent rust.
customer_reviews.author: Catie Myers

customer_reviews.title: Pedal keeps falling off - do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Nice body, classic look - BUT can’t use it-one of the pedals keeps falling off, so u can’t pedal the tricycle! our 3 yr old son can’t ride it - we took it to a bike store for a fix, the guy put a screw to try to hold the pedal in place, with no luck - do not recommend buying this tricycle-
customer_reviews.author: G. Daran

customer_reviews.title: Starting to rust after 5 months and little use
customer_reviews.text: Several of the metal bolts are rusted, 5 months after putting it together. It has NEVER been left outside, never been left in the rain, barely been ridden. Edited to 1 star. The wheels squeak loudly and it moves only grudgingly. My son tries to use it but can only move downhill or flat, not uphill. Why save a penny on cheap metal parts at the cost of your reputation?!?
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great tricycle!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it! However, don't order a few things at once when ordering this tricycle. We ordered this and a box of diapers. They, for whatever reason shipped together... in the same giant box! Undeliverable by the post office. They kept saying they'd deliver it, but the next day, then the next day... Finally it was my daughter birthday and they were closed. Had to go get it and give it to her late. The box was ridiculous, and probably 65 lbs. WTF Amazon??? Buy the bike! It's great. Buy it as a sole item purchase. Or buy it from somewhere not staffed by idiots. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: R. Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Shwinn Tricycle 12
customer_reviews.text: Great bike form shwinn. Really came though on this. Super easy to put together. No Nick's, scratching. Decal could have been better. Other than this awesome. My little dude loves it. Can grow into it as you can change the seating position as they get taller. Shwinn has been around forever. I'm Happy with this buy. In shwinn I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality geared towards longevity...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tricycle for our 2.5 year old little girl. The tricycle is very sturdy with a wide base and hasn't even come close to tipping over while our little girl has been using it. Another plus is the adjustable seat. This feature all but guarantees that it will be quite some time before our little one outgrows this tricycle. My brother and his little girl (age 4) were so impressed by this trike that he went and got one for her...albeit a different color! The quality of this tricycle is very impressive and we anticipate it lasting for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Horgan

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and attaractive
customer_reviews.text: Got this trike for Christmas for my (almost) 3 yr-old grandson who loved it. The colors are vivid and the chrome accents stand out nicely. He soon learned to maneuver the trike and always looks forward to an opportunity to ride it outdoors. My 19 yr-old son took the trike for an extended ride, and the trike survived unscathed. Well-built, sturdy and attractive. Not complicated to put together. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: getnitdone

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but marginal quality
customer_reviews.text: It is really pretty. Had my husband put it together for my grandson’s birthday. My grandson wrote it at his birthday and it literally fell apart. The connection part from the handlebars to the bike was too loose, based on the size of the bolts that came with it. The pedal also came off, despite Rick clipping it back on numerous times. Had my husband power rig it and it is good to go now.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila L. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Opened at Christmas and by May the pedal is broken; unusable tricycle
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who just turned 3. Within 5 months the medal started falling off and we would snap it back on but now it won't stay on. Completely unusable. I paid more for what I thought would be a more reliable tricycle. I've never heard of a pedal breaking?!!?
customer_reviews.author: LegitReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor engineered. Not surprised because it's made in china
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this bike. We have to returned it because the holes don't match where it should be at to be assemble. Very poor engineered. Not surprised because it's made in china.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Beginning to rust
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box was a very very beautiful tricycle. However after only one month being stored out in garage there is rust spreading all over the unpainted surfaces. Zoom in on the attached photo, the running board, the chrome fenders and handlebars. I was so excited about the beautiful retro look, but I’m so disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bet  Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Pedals Break & Replacements Not Available
customer_reviews.text: You buy this bike because it looks cool. The kids have fun riding it. It’s good for ages 3-5 — too bad it WILL NOT last that long. It took about 4 months after we purchased this tricycle for the pedals to break off. We have been unable to get pedal replacements from the company. The generic pedal replacements we looked into don’t work well. I’ve reached out to the company 3 times through their customer service email and got no response. Now we’ve bought a Radio Flyer tricycle because you can easily buy replacement parts on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: She is a tall and sturdy Little Angel
customer_reviews.text: Sooo cute! Our 18 month old GrandDarling loves her 1st trike!! She is a tall and sturdy Little Angel, so we decided to get her this full size trike, instead of a smaller, plastic "beginner model". Besides the Schwinn name and excellent quality, we chose this because of the low seat design. The styling makes this choice a more safe, comfortable and steady ride for her as she learns to maneuver and propel it. This trike is a little big for her now, (she can barely reach the peddles when she turns), but by spring, we think it will be a perfect fit! Very happy with this purchase, and couldn't resist the hot pink color choice!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great quality just as hoped!
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous ! Our daughter shrieked when she saw it under the tree. Seems to be great quality and just what we were looking for. We were able to adjust the seat closer since she is 2 1/2 and needed to be closer for pedals. She LOVES the horn! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Todd Watts

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made maybe unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: Name is Schwinn but poorly made. It took two orders to make a help descent one. Only time will tell not enough time to cancel and shop elsewhere. 1st time, handle bar and front wheel assembly were bend and crooked. Only cheap plastic as washer holds the front wheel loosely to frame assembly. Too much free play in the connection. Will watch closely, if any safety issue, will return. Too close to birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Siamak

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: A local bike shop did the build, of course. Once home, after 20 ft. of riding, the plastic seat needed to be tightened. We're just waiting for it to snap. Also, Schwinn name should be painted. Instead, it's printed on sticker decals. -I naturally assumed Schwinn was the go name when it came to children's bikes. Times have changed. Purchasing this new Schwinn bike makes me regret not getting an older, used model from a garage sale app.
customer_reviews.author: the revolution

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and fact its lower to ground
customer_reviews.text: Love the looks of this, low to ground for small ones, easy to put together. Grand daughter is two, she cann't quite reach pedals unless sccots way up, but just learning about that, wanted something for her to grow into and not be to small in 6 months, seems sturdy and should last her and her younger sister until moving onto a bike as long as take care of and keep out of weather. She goes to it everytime she sees it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this tricycle!! My 2 year old did also. It’s got plenty of room for her to grow with this tricycle and is sturdy. Definitely a great buy for us!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandson approved!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built tricycle. It’s solid and it looks both modern and retro at the same time. When my 2-year-old grandson saw it, he went to it immediately and climbed on. It’s his first choice of what to play with when he comes over. I’m quite pleased with my choice and so is my grandson. UPDATE: He’s had his Schwinn now for a couple months and it still looks brand new. This is a very solid trike. I can easily see this being handed down to his child in about 20 years and even a grandchild after that. I could t have made a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: LarryM

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, easy to assemble; quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Great bike! Very sturdy, easy to assemble, quality construction. Like the adjustable features of the seat and handlebars as child grows. Got it for a gift and the parents loved it, as did the toddler. There were a few nicks on the red paint of the bike out of the box, but we chose to overlook it as the quality is substantial. The bell is also quality and rings well too! I am sure it will see good use and gain a few more nicks over the years to come! I had always bought Schwinn bikes for their quality and durability in years past, and they did not disappoint! Thanks once again Schwinn!.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice looking trike.
customer_reviews.text: Everything went together pretty easy. It looks really sweet! The only thing, and I would have given it five stars except for these two things, is #1 the little bell mounted on the handle bars does not work and #2 the tire valve caps were not included. Should have had 3 caps for three tires. But other than those items, the tricycle is very nice and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Perezident

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Didn't last 1 year!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought last December (2016) and it worked well until now. The nuts to secure two back wheels fell off and the bike is not usable. Their capped nut seem unique. While it appears the size of 5/16'', the same size from home depot or other store doesn't work. And the back wheel locks up once a while and can't move forward. A good bike should last longer than 1 year !!
customer_reviews.author: J. Gao

customer_reviews.title: Arrived bent
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to give this to my son on his birthday, but I was very glad I put it together the night before. The frame was badly bent and make the trike unridable. Now I’m searching late into the evening trying to find another trike for tomorrow. If it hadn’t been defective, it would have been a nice trike.
customer_reviews.author: MomR

customer_reviews.title: THIS WAS NOT MADE FOR A TWO YEAR OLD
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited buying a shiny, pink bike for my two year old. She is taller then your average two year old and SHE CAN'T REACH THE PEDALS. She is almost three now, the seat has been adjusted to as close to the pedals as possible. She still can't reach them. This tricyle was designed for much bigger children, by the time she is big enough to ride it she will have transitioned to a balance bike. I am so disappointed with this purchase and wish I could return it. I trusted the Schwinn name, and it was a mistake iIwill not repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Khadija Taufique

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This bike is great quality however it came without pedals or caps for the tires. My son is so excited about it I don't want to return it so now I have to spend unnecessary time to find these parts
customer_reviews.author: Birschbach09

customer_reviews.title: Coolest, bestest tricycle ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest, heavy duty, well made tricycle there is (in my opinion) My grandson ( age 3 but looks 4)loved it and so did his parents. It is so much better in person that can be imagined from the photo on the website....truly worth the price....this tricycle will last for several generations and it is not tiny, it’s like the tricycles made in the “good old days”
customer_reviews.author: K Bowers

customer_reviews.title: A Classic of Childhood Play Fails the Test of Time
customer_reviews.text: The lovely Schwinn bike I praised in April has in four months become useless, having lost a petal. As I scrolled through questions today trying to find a resource to fix the petal problem I noted that this is a common complaint. I am hoping Amazon will come to the rescue and stand by this product which apparently is commonly defective. Until then I recommend they stop selling an otherwise sturdy tricycle whose petals fall off after a few months use.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Child

customer_reviews.title: Wow - love this trike!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot wait for Santa to deliver this to my grandson on Christmas Morning!!! This trike is well made, but have to admit it ... it's not been through the toddler test yet. This is so retro looking and the chrome on it is bright and beautiful - comes with chrome horn. I've looked for months for the right tricycle and this one just has me singing. Highly recommend - we ordered the aqua blue and it is so beautiful. Fairly easy to assemble - you will need to air up the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Live Laugh Love

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Myriad issues with this bike. Unfinished shard of metal at the top of the front wheel well, where the handlebars are to be attached. Sliced my hand open. The are no additional washers that come with the assembly, like really not even one spare so as to rectify the shoddy and ill-fitted connector. The handle bars dont properly operate as a result. Wont be able to get so much as ONE RIDE out of it. GARBAGE. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sly Fox Wills

customer_reviews.title: THIS BIKE IS TRASH!!!
customer_reviews.text: IMMEDIATELY THE PEDAL CAME OFF, WHEN I TRIED TO TAP IT BACK INTO PLACE IT SPLIT INTO TWO! AND THE HANDLE BARS KEEP TWISTING. WASTE OF MONEY! IF YOU'RE ON THE FENCE DON'T DO IT, DO NOT BUY IT!! MADE VERY CHEAPLY SOME PARTS ARE PLASTIC AND I CAN TELL YOU RIGHT NOW THOSE PLASTIC PIECES WILL NOT LAST THROUGH THE SUMMER. IF THE BABY HAD NOT SEEN IT ALREADY I WOULD HAVE SENT IT BACK. HE CAN NOT RIDE IT, HE HAS ONLY ONE PEDAL AND THE HANDLE BARS ARE TWISTED, IT FINALLY STRIPPED BECAUSE I HAD TO KEEP TIGHTENING THEM. WASTE OF MONEY I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO SPEND ADDITIONAL MONEY TO BUY ANOTHER PEDAL.
customer_reviews.author: Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Quality bike but problems with tire
customer_reviews.text: Updating to one star because you can't just replace the tire that was faulty I have to send the whole bike back and get a new one. My 3 yr old is devasted. This is a really nice bike and seems very sturdy. The reason I'm rating as 2 stars is because the front wheel is damaged and doesn't work. My son is very excited about this bike but after only one use, he can no longer ride it. I am so upset.
customer_reviews.author: Agall

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Front wheel bearing assembly is junk. It wobbles back and forth while pedaling over half an inch or more and makes a loud noise. Other than this bearing the thing would be great. But this is the main part of the whole tricycle. Will be returning this unless the seller will replace the part.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Some of the parts came in bent, but I was able to make all but one of them right. The way it was packaged it bent the BeJesus out of a spoke that I couldn't fix...Other than that, my first bike was a Schwinn so my granddaughters first was also a Schwinn...
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: expected perfection
customer_reviews.text: Given the reputation this brand has for quality bikes, I expected everything to be immaculate. However, the decals on the rear finders look like a child put them on. There are wrinkles in it where you can tell it didn't align properly when they attempted to adhere it. I hope the discount on the bike was due to this , but it would've been nice to know it was going to come that way. There's a bit of smudging from where an adhesive was, but there was no sticker removed from that area when I assembled the bike. I could upload photos, but I'm lazy so just take my word for it.
customer_reviews.author: Pure_Ohio_Fury

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The front fork and handlebar connection is poorly designed. The most important part of the trike and you blew it. Wobbly handelbars and pedals.....going back for sure. Expected better from SCHWINN!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID R TILLER

customer_reviews.title: Nice trike but missing and damaged parts
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice tricycle - looks great and works well. Would have been easy to assemble except for missing parts. The problem is quality control: 1. Missing the acorn nut and washer that holds most of it together. Had to spend 1 hour and $4 to buy the missing parts at a Home Depot. 2. The bell was smashed and would not function. Had to spend more time at two different Walmarts and $5 to replace the bell. 3. The "High quality" sticker was already peeling off. Made in China and the quality is not what I'd expect from Schwinn.
customer_reviews.author: pns

customer_reviews.title: Rear Axle/Bushing Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the trike for our 4 year old granddaughter who is quite athletic and advanced for her age. I state this because I wouldn’t expect her to have difficulty peddling the trike. The issue is with the rear wheel axle and plastic bushing arrangement. She probably has 10-12 hours of run time on the trike and the rear wheels squeak terribly. It has become very difficult for her to keep the trike moving due to the high friction between the bushings. No amount of lube has solved the problem. Highly disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great little bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike for my son. We got it 2 weeks ago. It’s easy to maneuver and easy to ride. Love the fact that we can adjust the seats as he grows. My son is 4 years old and it’s perfect for his size. The only negative part was tightening the handle. It Was a bit difficult. That’s why I gave it a 4 star. Overall I am very happy with this bike.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful design with safety in mind, will last, and it's a thing of beauty
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful kid tricycle that is sturdy and safe will last long enough to be passed on to another child as the present owner becomes older. I don't understand why other makers don't take the time to design solid, safe, and beautiful children toys of this type. Instead, what we see are designs that are cheap looking, don't have any art to them and are unsafe. That is why Schwinn is a respected brand. We are quite satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jmat

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Trike!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tricycle, bigger than I expected! Mine showed up 100% assembled and ready to go. All I did was adjust the steering wheel, which took less than a second, and we where ready to go! We have a Radio Flyer Trike as well and the Schwinn dwarfs it. I know I probably shouldn’t have, but I stood on the rear deck and it had no trouble supporting 185lb me. I would highly recommend this Trike, A real beauty! Thank You Schwinn
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: The bike is very beautiful. However, it broke in less than 10 months. The pedal assembly fell apart, and small metal balls started rolling out of the pedal assembly. The bell broke within the first 2 months of purchase. I've been trying to reach someone at Schwinn for several months with no luck. Schwinn's warranty is just a name, there does not seem to be any actual warranty or quality for that matter. I have an adult Schwinn bike, and break on that bike broke within 1 month of purchase. Not happy with the brand.
customer_reviews.author: INovice

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Save your $$!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the positive reviews. This thing is garbage! We purchased after looking at an older version at our neighbors. This looks identical, and after reading many positive reviews we pulled the trigger. Big mistake! 1. The fork wobbles loosely in the stem of the frame. Huge safety issue! 2. The handle bars don’t fasten securely, and continually come loose....again a safety issue. 3. Decals are poorly applied. After assembly we were so disappointed with the build quality we returned it immediately. This product should be recalled/discontinued. Don’t throw your money away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a Christmas gift for my granddaughter who was two months shy of turning two years old. My husband put it together the day it arrived because we wanted to make sure there were no issues in case we had to send it back. It was easy to assemble, all the parts were there, and no adjustments needed to be made. The quality was exactly what we hoped for .... it’s really nice and super cute. My granddaughter could not exactly reach both pedals, but this was not a concern. Kids grow quick and she’ll be paddling around the backyard any day. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it BUT
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2.5 year old grandson for Christmas. Tricycle went together well, and looks really nice. However, we discovered that the handle bars, once attached, will not stay stationary or in line with the front wheel....they move around. My husband took the handle bar off and roughed up the part that inserts in, but the handle bars still move around........and it's not like a two year old uses a lot of force on them. I think we are going to have to glue them somehow, which is disappointing because we may not be able to adjust the height of them later.
customer_reviews.author: MntMom

customer_reviews.title: Handle bars are crap!
customer_reviews.text: The handle bars to NOT stay straight when installed. Very disappointed in this bike as it can not be used for long before having the straighten them again. In 30 mind I've done it 5x!
customer_reviews.author: tina rauert

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality welds on the frame. Cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: How ironic to have a quality label on this bike! Look at the pictures, these welds are just horrible goose berries covered with paint. Pretty sure they are not going to last and will break with use. Have to watch it now so my kid will not get injured when this happens. Wherever you look on this bike it has super cheap cheesy materials, bad assembly and manufacturing. Steering column has a very noticeable give to it, probably bad fit plastic bushing. Mud guards are bent. It goes on and on. Overall, very disappointed and concerned.
customer_reviews.author: KayTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: I’m 6 foot two and don’t have to bend over to use the handle – it’s great
customer_reviews.text: It’s great to be able to take a two-year-old for a walk and help them along otherwise they get tired in about half a block! I’m 6 foot two and don’t have to bend over to use the handle – it’s great
customer_reviews.author: john O

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Kids Who Want To Ride Bikes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom's son and he really loves this bike. It is easy to learn and ride, safe, and is easy to control once you get started. The design is well done and the wheels are of high quality. The whole bike is made with durable material and can be cleaned once a week without much trouble. I highly recommend this toy for people with children who want to learn how to ride their first bike.
customer_reviews.author: SiamicTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Broken pedal on very first ride!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very sad. We have had this for a couple of years because I got too excited after having my first baby, well he was finally big emote ride it and the pedal fell off! There is absolutely no way to put it back on because of the way it fits. It slides off and leaves a bare metal rod, which is impossible for a small child to keep their foot hold on. It is actually dangerous now and I’m beyond disappointed as I’ve waited forever for him to ride it. I wish I could contact the company to find a way to have it repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Mia

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Our preschool uses this tricycle for little ones who are learning to ride. It has held up very well with hours of daily use so I got one. Very easy to assemble, though one bolt broke while still quite loose in the tightening process. It's a nice tricycle for learning because it's light weight so not a lot of work to push it, and adults can manage steering while child pedals, and child can learn to pedal by giving some of the effort til they get strong enough to pedal all on their own. All in all, a great tricycle for learning to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NICE BIKE BUT....
customer_reviews.text: Recieved this bike assembly was a little complex took about 30 minutes to assemble. Once assembled it’s a very nice tricycle but I bought it for a small 3.5 year old and he has difficulty fitting in it and getting out of it!! Once he is in it he is able to reach peddles and handle bars with ease. I would not have paid so much for a first time trike had I known it would not last for up to a year as he will out grow this soon. I would recommend for much younger children I don’t think I would buy it again even if he just turned 3. Hope this helps others.
customer_reviews.author: nancy green

customer_reviews.title: terrible handlebar design
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this bike, get others, many out there! This one is designed so bad, not with a functionality in mind. This is the first bike my toddler had and made him hate biking, the handlebar is so wide that it is not sensitive when taking turns, and even going straight.
customer_reviews.author: Yasemin

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves his new trike
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3yr old grandson's first tricycle and it is great, he won't get off of it. He quickly learned how to pedal and now he's a little speed demon. I wanted to get him something to burn off some of that nearly limitless energy and have fun, not drive electric kiddie cars. It's very sturdy, real rubber inflated tires, and steel everything else.
customer_reviews.author: FormosaTiger

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a birthday present for my 2 year old son. He loves it! He is 80cm tall and his feet just miss the pedal when it is far out. So in about a month he will be able to ride it. It looks very durable and is very stabel. Shipping weight is 22lb. Pro: - full metal -big rubber tires - bel - plank (you could also tie wrap a container on top of the plank) Cons: - the black v-shaped stickers on will come off eventually. It’s not painted on.
customer_reviews.author: karin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. We got one and one of the pieces was broken. We waited HOURS literally for Schwinn customer service. Finally got someone who told us they would send a replacement part but hung up before giving any details. No part ever came. We exchanged through Amazon thinking it was a fluke. NO!!!!! The next one was WORSE! Called Schwinn again .... no one ever answered mu son could never even ride them. An incredibly frustrating experience all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Lscorp

customer_reviews.title: Strong frame. Flimsy everything else
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived defective. The front tire came off on the first ride. Only to realize that the fender attachment to the Front tire was stripped out (this was NOT a piece that was self assembled). The caps on both the back tires broke during assembly and the handlebars were very difficult to get tightened. The air valves were missing caps. We were able to jimmy the wheel to stay screwed with our own hardware. But the piece should be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: WednesdayWonders

customer_reviews.title: GREAT buy!!! We love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a find! It doesn’t come with the tools to assemble it, but it’s fairly easy to put together. It’s easy to adjust the size, so as my grandson grows, the trike can grow with him. I got a sale price and it only cost 68$......such a steal! This is a sturdy well made retro looking tricycle! We didn’t have ANY of the problems the other negative reviews had. It’s honestly one of my favorite Amazon buys! Not a cheap plastic bike, but a good old fashioned sturdy trike!!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: madison leago

customer_reviews.title: Frame out of alignment, impossible to correct or use
customer_reviews.text: The frame of this bike was ridiculously warped. There is no way quality control looked at this. Schwinn should be ashamed, to be completely honest. Either that or this was some third-party selling the rejects. Stay far far away.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: The tricycle was purchased as a present for my grandsons second birthday. With the seat in the forwardmost position, he is just able to reach the pedals. As he grows he will be able to use it until it's time to step up to a two wheeler. He loves the trike. After reading some of the negative reviews, I was slightly concerned about quality. I had no problems assembling the tricycle. It's solid and sturdy and I expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Gary DyJack

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool but wheels don't roll well and heavy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a year now and it looks really cool but does not work that great. Wheels roll on a metal axle with plastic bushing and they stop rolling after a couple turns despite making sure everything is in proper adjustment and plenty of silicone lubricant. It is also heavy at 21 pounds for toddlers, my mountain bike weighs in at about 26 lbs. I'm planning to get a light weight plastic one that will roll better.
customer_reviews.author: Rykers Parents

customer_reviews.title: Going back...
customer_reviews.text: The tricycle looks awesome but there were some issues. Took delivery and the packaging was fine. Got the parts out and inspected. The metal tire covers were warped and bent. No big deal, got a rubber mallet and some rubber clamps and straightened it out. Then attempted to assemble, well... the last pieces #16 and #18 I believe, the bolt and nut holding the handlebars is missing. Went to the garage found a bolt and nut and thought that would work but no go. The handlebars just swivel around. Have to send it back unfortunately. It's a nice looking tricycle that looks sturdy but the aggravation of doing this again is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tricycle from Santa to grow with my baby
customer_reviews.text: Super cute gift from Santa this year. My daughter is 22 months old and can’t pedal yet...but I LOVE how this tricycle allows child to grow with an adjustable seat. The metal rim came slightly dented...but not enough to send back or really complain about. The bell that comes with the tricycle sure adds to the CUTENESS of this bike. ...I had the Radioflyer for a different child and that one is also cute...but the real air filled rubber tires that this tricycle comes with makes the ride more gentle. I love this tricycle! It’s very much worth the price. The warranty is SWEET as well!
customer_reviews.author: C.N.S.

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty light purplish pink
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy, not just toy quality. I held off on ordering this earlier because other reviews pointed out that the sticker decals didn’t match the color on the rest of the bike, so I got her the radio flyer. That one was extremely light wait and tipped over easily. My daughter has grown and is 2.5 now. This fits her perfectly with closest seat setting. The color is a purplish pink, which I happen to like more than plain old pink. And they have listened to reviews and corrected the problem of mismatched stickers. They are exact match now.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not Schwinn’s best
customer_reviews.text: Given the name I expected more from the tricycle. They don’t make them like they used too which is a bummer. Wood on the back is easily damaged, so don’t buy it for that reason. Haven’t figured out how to keep the wheels from getting to tight, may need to add a couple of aftermarket washers to help but most of the bearing are encased in plastic not metal. My daughter loves to ride it though, but it requires constant maintenance. Bought it for nostalgic purposes for my 3 yr old daughter. She’ll be moving on to a bike with training wheels soon though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walter Johnson

customer_reviews.title: poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly constructed. Frame was welded crooked. Front wheel about 10 or 15 degrees out of whack . Obviously no quality control or quality inspection before packaging. I guess Schwinn is now junk made in China, not at all like when I was a kid. Bummer is when you spend an hour assembling for a 3 year old's birthday and then have to return it hoping the next one you buy might accidentally be welded properly. Nice design and style though.
customer_reviews.author: squirrel proof??

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. My son grew into this after his Fisher Price. While he could sit in it at first, it is heavy due to the quality of the materials it is constructed from. After a couple of riders around the neighborhood where he got tired (first time in his life), he is now strong enough to use it and keeps going and going and going. Be patient. It pays off. This is amazing. He even has a spot on the back for his teddy to come along for the ride!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gondor

customer_reviews.title: Well made tricycle
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson who lives far away from us but his parents have shared with us how great this bike is. It is well made with metal, no plastic, it fits our grandson who is 31/2 and is just learning to ride it since it is his first one. It was easily assembled, there was a small problem with the handle bar but seems it was easily fixed. I would recommend this tricycle even if it cost a little more than some. It is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: charjae

customer_reviews.title: Shame on Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a Christmas present in early January. It has been ridden three times (we've had record breaking rainfall so they couldn't get out to ride very often). The third time was yesterday. They were riding around and the steering bar came off. Mom put it back on. A little further along, the entire bike completely fell apart. Completely fell apart. Of course, the return window closed on 31 January.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Gargravarr

customer_reviews.title: It was stored in the garage through the winter and was never left outside in bad weather.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tricycle for my 3 year old’s birthday present in September of 2017 and the fork snapped in half when he had rode it for the first time since winter. It was stored in the garage through the winter and was never left outside in bad weather.. My 3 year old is devistated..
customer_reviews.author: David Beal

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. My 3 year old probably rode it no ...
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. My 3 year old probably rode it no more than 10 times for no more than 5-10 minutes each time and one of the pedals just fell off. I never saw him misuse the bike and have no idea how it could have happpened. It was just broken inside the pedal and no way to repair. The bell also did not work when we got the bike. For the amount of money we paid, I would have hoped for much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: My son loves his trike!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our three year old and he LOVES it. He hasn't quite figured out peddling, but has enough room to "walk"/push himself/scoot along while seated on the bike. The bell is a big hit as well. Materials are nice -- metal frame, good quality paint and decals. The only gripe I have is the seat which is plastic and feels flimsy compared to the rest of the trike. Overall we are happy with our purchase because it makes our son happy.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: 1st one was exchanged quickly due to bent frames over the back wheels and the replacement arrived within 2 days. She's 39"tall and got this for her 3rd birthday. I put little lights on the front since she's a nite owl. The only negative thing is the bell is a little janky sounding and the front tire needed air. But all in all this is big enough to last a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mates

customer_reviews.title: Tricycle dream come true!
customer_reviews.text: This tricycle was awesome! It’s exactly as described and I love that it comes equipped with tassels and bell!! It took 5-10 mins to assemble and was extremely easy to put together, it only required one tool. My son loves it and rides it all the time! My only complaint is that whoever puts the decals on the bicycle fenders put our on crooked, and because it’s a chevron design if placed crooked it looks wonky. It bugs me, I can redo it but my son doesn’t mind and that’s what matters. (See photo)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Durable and cute!
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect gift for my daughter’s 3rd birthday! She was so excited she wanted to go for a night ride. People have complimented it and have asked where we bought it, so it definitely catches your eye and looks pretty cool! This is the second tricycle I’ve bought since March, we got a cheaper one but the pedal broke off, this one seems extremely durable and will undoubtedly make it until she’s ready for a bigger bike!
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Bad Pedals
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking bike but after two of them each having issues with the pedals I looked elsewhere. The first one had one pedal that was very hard to turn. I tried a few things but nothing freed it up. I exchanged it for another one (they were out of my color so I had to pay more for another color). The next one came and after about a minute of riding it one pedal fell off. I looked inside and the plastic was mangled. Keep in mind the pedals come assembled so this is not user error. Maybe I got a couple of bad ones. The rest of the bike seemed nice.
customer_reviews.author: A Z.

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was terrible due to incorrect bolt/screw sizes
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a pain to assemble. The bolts that came with it didn’t match, and one of the screws even broke! There was also a blemish on the body of the tricycle. My 2.5 yr old likes to ride it, but does get tired. compared to her Radio Wagon plastic tricycle this one has rubber wheels so it’s not as easy to pedal. She may need to be a little older to enjoy it. IG @LifeWithAvaAndElla
customer_reviews.author: Life With Ava & Ella

customer_reviews.title: Great trike crappy wheels
customer_reviews.text: Very cool little trike. However I subtracted 2 stars because the inner tubes and tires wouldn't seat properly on the rims. One inner tube popped during assembly just before my grandson came over for his birthday. Fortunately a local bike shop had another and with a little tweeking all 3 tires and tubes were ready with 5 minutes to spare. Great little trike but beware.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Well built and safe but not without problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2-1/2 year old grandson for Christmas. Well built and made mostly of steel and not the cheap plastic that everything seems to be made of these days. I liked the fact that it's a low rider, much safer than traditional tricycles. It's a little big for a 2 year old, but it's real close and has plenty of room to grow for a 4 or 5 year old (seat is adjustable). The one major problem is both rear wheels have locked up......the wheels won't turn. There aren't any brakes, so I an guessing the bushings might need a little oil.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: 1st, this stickers were applied with all the skill a 4 year old could muster. 2nd, removing the poorly applied stickers was hard and to remove the goo required special goo removal formula from the store. 3rd, paint is scratched by factory assembly. 4th, steering bar is loose and cheaply conceived. 5th, fenders have poorly applied stickers which cannot be removed because they cover up a terrible paint job. 6th, tires do not have nozzle caps. I would never buy this again or recommend anyone pay so much for such a bad product which was obviously packaged and stickered in part by child labor. Made in China
customer_reviews.author: Spence

customer_reviews.title: The second one came with some paint chipping off of the fender but decided to keep it anyway because our granddaughter loved it so much
customer_reviews.text: This tricycle is so cute however the first one we ordered had to be send back because the shaft that ran from the handlebars to the front wheel was crooked and therefore made the front wheel wobbly. The second one came with some paint chipping off of the fender but decided to keep it anyway because our granddaughter loved it so much. I would love to give it 5 stars because of how happy it made our granddaughter but with the issues I couldn't do that. However she has really enjoyed it and I'm sure she will have lots of fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Usry

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and left my 3 year old confused
customer_reviews.text: I’m so bummed out with this purchase especially after reading great reviews. I thought I made The best choice for my sons first bike. I bought this for my sons 3rd birthday and he had never even seen a bike before. After showing him how to pedal the handle bar continuously turned every time he would turn left or right and I would have to stop and fix it. He was so confused and I was left disappointed and bummed for him. The bike came with specific instructions how to avoid this but no matter how many times we tightened it without fail it would turn. Such a cute bike but poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: kristina

customer_reviews.title: lower center of gravity makes it safer than the standard tricycle
customer_reviews.text: This trike is so much better than the standard tricycle you see at toy stores. What makes it better? The center of gravity is great making it less likely to tip over on a sharp turn. Having a backrest makes it much more comfortable for longer distance riding. Another positive is adjusting the seating, which allows you to move the seat front to back for longer leg kiddos. This is a 5 star all the way and heavily recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: j walker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase for the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2 year old grandson for Christmas. He has not been able to use it yet as he is small and it is snowy here so by the time spring comes I look forward to getting him out and on it. This is a very sturdy trike. I believe he will live on it once he learns as he loves being outside. Perfect purchase .... he will use it for at least a few years and then another grand baby can take it over as it is well built!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No response to problems....JUST IGNORED
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our grandson and it is really nice BUT had two problems, the second of which is a pedal that won't stay on. Several emails and numerous attempts to call but no answer - The service and warranty department does not exist or ignores you - Don't get stuck as we have a 3 year old who wants his bike to work and thiere is not excuse for such disgraceful conduct of the seller. Be warned
customer_reviews.author: Neufman

customer_reviews.title: Pedal fell off. Unable to repair.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy. smooth ride. Though I have had it for 6 months it is only used when my grandchildren visit and the weather permits. Probably used less than 10 times. Kids enjoyed but the pedal came off. I have tried to tape it or get a replacement. But cannot find one. Sadly trickle is useless. Past returnable date. Update on August 21,20 still no one has contacted me or responded. This item is under warranty for one year. They don't answer the calls. If I could give ZERO Stars I would
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and So Cool!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old son has some challenges, and he's a long way from being able to ride a two-wheeler, even with training wheels. This trike is an AMAZING alternative! We are only in the middle setting of the adjustable seat, so there is plenty of room to grow. The wheels have real tubes in there! The bike LOOKS amazing - which is extra fun for my little guy, and he can make it go so fast! The fringe and bell come already attached, and we had the entire bike assembled and ready to roll in about 15 minutes. He rides it all day - I'm so glad we didn't wait until Christmas to give it to him!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Shepler

customer_reviews.title: Defective bike. Must return based on my explanation
customer_reviews.text: I ORDERED early for Grandsons birthday.. I bake to secure steering column to frame called schwinn 2 weeks ago. They finally shipped a new bracket to secure steering which did not work. I took bike to aaaa bike shop paid try to fix this problem. Still can't tight steering due to heavy steel frame not giving to lock steering. Amazon should accept this return because I registered this problem. Prior to 39 day window with schwinn who took their sweet time to send me part otherwise would have been returned to exchange for same bike. Please replace my Grandsons bike which he can't enjoy
customer_reviews.author: thomas lipiros

product_meta.title: Schwinn Roadster Tricycle for Toddlers and Kids
product_meta.description: Make memories that will last a lifetime with the Schwinn 12 in. Roadster Tricycle. This retro-styled children's trike is designed with a low center of gravity, making climbing on and off during play easy and safe. Mustache-style cruiser handlebars, chrome fenders and a bell add a nostalgic flair that Mom and Dad will appreciate, while your future roadster rolls quickly and smoothly down the neighborhood. Bike Style Tricycle Wheel Size 12 in. Rear Wheel Size 8 in. Assembly Assembly Required Shipping Method FedEx Weight 24.4 lb. Length 26 in. Width 20.5 in. Height 21.5 in. Frame Steel Warranty: 5 Year Manufacturer Warranty Age For 2-4 years
feature_bullets: Tricycle or Trike is easy to ride, low center of gravity. Perfect for first bike for young riders, The adjust able seat, fits 3 to 5 years
Adjustable sculpted seat has 5 positions so it moves forwards and backwards for growing legs or different family members.
Chrome finish handlebars with tassels and bell make this a great gift and a family photo moment.
Full-steel heavy-duty construction with fenders, real wood deck with etched-in logo. It will last and look great.
Classic Schwinn styling and details, detail painted fenders, chrome look emblems and wrapped grips

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
